sen.e: Entering the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan) when Yoshitane ASHIKAGA and Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA both stood as shogun, the Bugyoshu divided as well and mutually existed in both bakufu structures.
sen.cmt: スペースを補足しました。

sen.j: また、この時期になると御前沙汰に将軍が出席するのも稀となり、将軍の側近集団によって新たに再編された内談衆（殿中申次・内談方）が奉行衆による沙汰の結論を将軍に伝えて裁可を仰ぐようになった。
sen.e: In this period, shogun seldom attended Gozensata and Naidanshu (Assistants for Council) (Denchu moshitsugi, Naidankata), which was newly organized by the close aides of shogun, transmitted the decisions made by Bugyoshu to shogun and obtained approval.

The shogun seldom attended Gozensata during this period and the Naidanshu (Assistants for Council) (Denchu moshitsugi, Naidankata), reorganized by close associates to the shogun, transmitted decisions made by the Bugyoshu to the shogun and obtained approval.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The shogun seldom attended Gozensata during this period and the Naidanshu (Assistants for Council) (denchu moshitsugi (transmitter or transmitting of messages of the palaces), Naidankata), reorganized by close associates to the shogun, transmitted decisions made by the Bugyoshu to the shogun and obtained approval.
sen.cmt: 補足しました。

sen.j: このように奉行衆は室町幕府の行政機構を支える存在として幕府滅亡まで存続したと考えられている。
sen.e: As seen from the above, it is considered that Bugyoshu continued to exist and support the administrative structure of the Muromachi bakufu until its collapse.
It believed that it was in this manner that the Bugyoshu continued to exist as an entity that supported the administrative structure of the Muromachi bakufu until its collapse.
